Running time110 minutes[1]CountryUnited StatesLanguageEnglish
Gasoline Rainbow is a 2023 American drama film, written, directed, shot, and edited by the Ross brothers. It stars Tony Abuerto, Micah Bunch, Nichole Dukes, Nathaly Garcia
and Makai Garza.
The film had its world premiere at the 80th Venice International Film Festival on September 7, 2023. It is scheduled to be theatrically released on May 10, 2024 before streaming on Mubi on May 31, 2024.


Plot[edit]
Five teenagers embark on one last adventure to the Pacific Coast.[2]

Cast[edit]
Tony Abuerto
Micah Bunch
Nichole Dukes
Nathaly Garcia
Makai Garza
Production[edit]
Production took place in late 2021, with a crew of several people.[3]

Release[edit]
The film had its world premiere at the 80th Venice International Film Festival in the Orizzonti section.[4] Prior to, Mubi, who produced and financed the film, acquired distribution rights to the film.[5] It will also screened at South by Southwest and the First Look Festival at the Museum of the Moving Image in March 2024.[6][7]
The film is scheduled for a limited theatrical release in the United States on May 10, 2024, followed by a streaming release on Mubi three weeks later on May 31, 2024.[8]
